newsitem.title: UK: Britain's Slough remains firm on property.
newsitem.headline: Britain's Slough remains firm on property.

text.p: Slight recovery in the commercial property market boosted the operating performance of British property developer Slough Estates during 1996.

Slough on Thursday reported a 6.8 percent rise in its pretax profit to 75.5 million pounds ($123 million) from 70.7 million pounds with its operating income marginally ahead at 132.7 million pounds from 130 million pounds.

The group's showing could have been better had it not suffered a loss on sale of investment properties of 4.6 million pounds which included a four million pound costs of closure of its Australian operations.
Sale of properties had yielded in profits of 0.7 million pounds in 1995. The group's pretax profits, adjusted against these losses showed 80.1 million pounds.
Adverse exchange rate movements, mainly the increase in strength of the sterling cost Slough 1.9 million pounds, the company said.
The group's earnings per share rose to 12 pence from 11.1 in the previous year as it offered a total dividend of nine pence per share against 8.5 in the previous year. ($ = 0.614 British Pounds)
